content: houndstooth check mittens ho undstooth check mittens | by sarah arnold wickedstitches wordpress com 1 | p age i adore graphic patterned mittens knitted with worsted weight wool at a tight gauge i often make some for teachers to save time and to ensure accurate sizing check gauge and friends for the holidays they look complicated but are surprisingly simple to make the small needles create a gauge dense firm and relatively windproof fabric there is one 28 24 stitches in colourwork pattern equals 4 inches /10 chart for the mitten body and thumb and different sizes can cm after blocking be achieved by changing needle size and using a heavier/lighter worsted weight yarn resulting in a looser gauge notes and abbreviations size & finished measurements mc - main colour sizes child large/woman s small woman s medium cc contrasting colour sts- stitches finished measurements small = 6 5 inches around medium = 8 inches around all charts are read from right to left starting in the bottom right corner suggested yarn 2 skeins 1 main colour 1 contrast colour of patons classic notions scrap yarn for holding thumb stitches and wool cascade 220 lamb s pride worsted or briggs & little darning needle heritage  ~113 yards/ 104 meters main colour  ~86 yards/ 80 meters contrast colour needles you may choose to work mittens using magic-loop or double points the chart is the same for all sizes it is the needle size yarn choice and gauge that will yield different size mittens  small 3 0 mm/ 2 us needles for ribbed cuff 3 5 mm/ 4 us needles for mitten body  medium 3 5 mm/ 4 us needles for ribbed cuff 4 0 mm/ 6 us needles for mitten body 2 | p age important pattern notes yarn dominance when knitting with 2 colours of yarn it is important to be consistent in terms of how you carry each strand of yarn for example the red and white mittens were knit with the yarns being carried on either side of the index finger of the right hand english style knitting white was always on top and red was always beneath the yarn that is carried beneath becomes dominant in stranded knitting as long as the way the yarns are carried is consistent then the background and foreground of each mitten will remain out the same there are numerous youtube videos demonstrating different techniques for 2 colour knitting many people carry a yarn in the right hand and a yarn in the left and knit a combination of english and continental style continental knitters may also be interested in a stranded yarn guide cast on ribbed cuff  cast on 40 stitches using smaller size needles 3 0mm 3 5mm or 4 0mm  join for working in the round making sure that stitches are not twisted  rib for 2-3 inches as follows knit 2 purl 2 repeat to end of row change to larger needle
